text:
Allow multiple http send parameter values to read from a file that is in some 
specified format (XML, comma delimited, etc...).  Also allow send parameter 
values read in from the file to be applied sequentially or randomly during the 
test run.
creator: Michael_Pella@appliedcard.com
muntuck@gentuck.com
text:
This is a useful feature to test some real-world situations. 
Consider a case for testing checkin for a guest who has reserved a place in a 
hotel. We need to checkin a person who has reserved a place. 
SO, this requires a read from some database or a file, and another read from 
another file of other parameters. This is associated with the send parameters. 

Would be good if we can associate one send paramter from file-A, and another 
send parameter from file-B, and so on.

creator: tjsb@slb.com
text:
If you upgrade to 1.9 RC3 you should be able to use the function _CSVRead() or 
_StringFromFile() for this. 

__CSVRead() reads from a CSV file, and returns the appopriate elements from the 
line. You cab only have one such file.

_StringFromFile() reads a whole line from a file; you can read from multiple 
files.

Or are you thinking of something further, which is not covered by either of the 
above?
